newsitem.title: ROMANIA: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.
newsitem.headline: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.

text.p: * Parliament's upper and lower chambers continue debates on the 1997 budget law and voted chapters on social protection, industry, trade and agriculture expenditures.
Some 5.5 trillion lei were allocated for social security.
* The budget chapters for farming and mining stirred heated debates, with MPs of the Party of Social Democracy (PDSR) criticising the budget draft for cutting subsidies to the mining sector.
Parliament adopted the article providing 1,071 billion lei in mining subsidies in its original version.
* Opposition proposals for amendments to increase subsidies to various sectors were rejected because they did not mention means to fund bigger budget expenditures.
* Romanian Foreign Minister Adrian Severin will start tour of Italy and the U.S. to plead for the country's early NATO admission, foreign ministry spokeswoman Gilda Lazar said.
She said Severin would start an official visit to Italy on Wednesday to meet Italian President Oscar Luigi Scalfaro, Prime Minister Romano Prodi and his counterpart Lamberto Dini.
Severin will also pay an official visit to Washington starting April 20 with a similar mission, Lazar said. He is expected to meet U.S. Secretary of State Madeleine Albright.
* Romania's former King Michael will make a two-week visit to Romania to celebrate Orthodox Easter. He will visit Timisoara, Brasov and Iasi and will only spend one day in Bucharest.
